name: Red Flowering Currant
climate: The Red Flowering Currant thrives in temperate climates with mild winters.
This plant is native to the Pacific Northwest which has a relatively cool climate.
It can tolerate a wide range of temperatures but not extreme cold or heat.
Moderate humidity levels are ideal for the growth of this plant species.
sunlight: Red Flowering Currant prefers full sun for optimal growth but tolerates partial shade.
It should receive at least six hours of direct sunlight per day to thrive well.
The plant can adapt to less sunlight in extremely hot climates to prevent burning.
In shaded areas, flowering might be reduced, though the plant will still survive.
watering: Regular watering is important during the plant's first year to establish roots.
Once established, the Red Flowering Currant becomes more drought tolerant.
Avoid overwatering as this can lead to root rot and other moisture-related issues.
Ensure soil is moist during growing season, but reduce water in fall and winter.
soil: Prefers well-drained soils rich in organic matter with good aeration.
Red Flowering Currant tolerates a range of soil types, including clay and sandy soil.
Soil pH should ideally be slightly acidic to neutral for optimal growth conditions.
Adding mulch can help retain moisture and regulate soil temperature effectively.
extra_care_tip: Prune after flowering to maintain shape and enhance the next season's blooms.
